comments:
If a composite cheat sheet contains a cheatsheet task and the cheatsheet is specified using an id that does not match any registered cheatsheet an NPE is thrown and the task editor is not opened, the hyperlink to "Start Working on this Task" is still displayed.

java.lang.NullPointerException

Here's a simple test case

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<compositeCheatsheet name="Invalid Id Test">
    <task kind = "cheatsheet" name= "Invalid Id test">
         <intro> 
             A cheatsheet task with invalid id
         </intro>
         <param name="id" value = "no.such.id"/>    
    </task>
</compositeCheatsheet>

This one doesn't actually concern me too much for 3.2. I would classify it under "improve error reporting". It will only hit the user if a product releases a broken cheatsheet that clearly wasn't tested. It would make it easier for authors to debug problems in their cheat sheets though. Personally I don't think it's critical.
I agree that it's not critical, most users would not run into this. It's easy enough to fix, I'll attach a patch.

Created an attachment (id=40968)
Patch

This patch can be used to fix the problem (post 3.2).
+1 if you choose to fix it in RC4.

Wassim, I'd like to invite you to vote on inclusion of this fix in RC4.

Targeting RC4 pending one more vote.
Released to HEAD and map file updated for inclusion in RC4.
